episodeTitle: Everyone Together! Luffy, Setting Out for the New World!
description: After two years of separation, the Straw Hat Pirates reunite at the Thousand Sunny on Sabaody Archipelago. Despite Marine interference led by Rear Admiral Catacombo, the crew successfully escapes with help from allies including Boa Hancock, Rayleigh, and Perona, setting sail for Fish-Man Island and the New World.

events.title: Luffy, Zoro, and Sanji Arrive at Grove #42
events.description: After demonstrating their new strength against the Pacifista, Luffy, Zoro, and Sanji finally reach Grove #42 where the Thousand Sunny is docked. They are the last three crew members to arrive at the rendezvous point, completing the crew's gathering after two years of separation.
events.significance: This marks the beginning of the long-awaited full crew reunion, bringing together the Monster Trio at the ship where the rest of the crew is already waiting. It's a pivotal moment that transitions from individual reunions to the complete Straw Hat crew assembling.

events.title: Full Straw Hat Crew Reunion - First Time in Two Years
events.description: All nine Straw Hat Pirates reunite on the Thousand Sunny for the first time since their separation at Sabaody Archipelago two years ago. Luffy, Zoro, and Sanji join Nami, Usopp, Chopper, Robin, Franky, and Brook, with each member displaying their post-timeskip appearances and new abilities. The emotional reunion is filled with excitement, laughter, and amazement at each other's transformations.
events.significance: This is the most emotionally significant moment of the Return to Sabaody Arc and one of the most important scenes in the entire series. After 118 episodes of separation (since Episode 404), the crew is finally whole again, marking the true beginning of the second half of One Piece and the crew's journey into the New World.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy greeting his crew after two years apart

events.title: Sanji's Nosebleed Reaction to Nami and Robin
events.description: Upon seeing the post-timeskip Nami and Robin for the first time, Sanji suffers a massive nosebleed so severe that he collapses and falls off the ship into the ocean. His two years on Momoiro Island with the okama have made him even more susceptible to beautiful women, nearly causing him to lose consciousness.
events.significance: A comedic moment that demonstrates how Sanji's character hasn't changed despite his training, and foreshadows the nosebleed problems he'll face in the Fish-Man Island arc. It also shows that while the crew has grown stronger, their core personalities remain intact.

events.title: Crew Reacts to Franky's New Cyborg Body
events.description: The Straw Hats express shock and amazement at Franky's drastically modified appearance after his two-year upgrade in Vegapunk's laboratory. His new BF-37 model body features massive shoulders, bulkier arms, and various new mechanical features, prompting mixed reactions from the crew.
events.significance: Showcases Franky's technological advancement and commitment to becoming stronger for the crew. His new form demonstrates the extent to which each crew member went to improve themselves during the timeskip.

events.title: Marine Fleet Led by Rear Admiral Catacombo Attacks
events.description: Rear Admiral Catacombo leads a Marine fleet to capture the reunited Straw Hat Pirates at Grove #42. Multiple Marine ships surround the Thousand Sunny, with Catacombo ordering a full assault to prevent the notorious crew from escaping to the New World. The Marines open fire with cannons and prepare to board the ship.
events.significance: Represents the World Government's immediate response to the Straw Hats' return and sets up the episode's main conflict. This attack demonstrates that despite two years passing, the Marines are still actively pursuing the crew and view them as a major threat.

quotes.text: Don't let the Straw Hat Pirates escape! Capture them all!
quotes.speaker: Rear Admiral Catacombo
quotes.context: Catacombo ordering his forces to attack the Straw Hats

events.title: Boa Hancock and the Kuja Pirates Arrive to Protect Luffy
events.description: Boa Hancock arrives with her ship and the Kuja Pirates, positioning herself between the Marine fleet and the Thousand Sunny. Despite being a Warlord of the Sea, Hancock openly defies the Marines to protect Luffy, using her ship to block the Marine vessels and prevent them from reaching the Straw Hats.
events.significance: Demonstrates Hancock's unwavering love for Luffy and her willingness to risk her Warlord position to protect him. This intervention is crucial in allowing the Straw Hats to escape and shows how Luffy's influence has created powerful allies who will act against the World Government for his sake.

quotes.text: I will not let you lay a finger on Luffy!
quotes.speaker: Boa Hancock
quotes.context: Hancock declaring her protection of Luffy to the Marines

events.title: Rear Admiral Catacombo's Debut
events.description: Rear Admiral Catacombo, a middle-aged Marine officer with black hair, a mustache, and a stubbly beard, makes his first appearance as the commander of the Marine forces attempting to capture the Straw Hat Pirates. He leads the assault on Grove #42 but is ultimately thwarted by the intervention of Hancock and other allies.
events.significance: Introduces a new Marine officer character who represents the World Government's continued pursuit of the Straw Hats. While not a major antagonist, Catacombo's presence shows that the Marines are mobilizing significant resources to prevent the crew's escape.

events.title: Perona Uses Negative Hollow Against Marines
events.description: Perona appears after two years and immediately aids the Straw Hats by using her Negative Hollow ability against the attacking Marines. Her ghost projections pass through the Marines, draining their will and causing them to become extremely pessimistic and depressed, effectively neutralizing multiple soldiers at once.
events.significance: Demonstrates that Perona, despite her previous antagonistic role, has become an ally willing to help the Straw Hats. This shows the impact of her time with Zoro and reflects the theme of former enemies becoming friends through shared experiences.

events.title: Rayleigh's Emotional Farewell to Luffy
events.description: Silvers Rayleigh bids an emotional farewell to Luffy and the Straw Hat crew. With tears in his eyes, he remembers the intensive training he provided to Luffy over the past two years and feels proud seeing his student ready to set sail for the New World. Rayleigh slashes the ground, creating a line and warning the Marines not to cross it, buying the Straw Hats precious time.
events.significance: Marks the end of Luffy's training period and symbolizes his graduation from student to independent pirate ready to challenge the New World. Rayleigh's tears show his emotional investment in Luffy's success and his hope that this new generation will accomplish what Roger's generation could not. The ground slash demonstrates Rayleigh's continued overwhelming power.

quotes.text: We will meet again someday. Until then, keep getting stronger!
quotes.speaker: Rayleigh

events.title: Luffy Thanks His Crew and Commands Departure
events.description: Luffy addresses his crew, thanking them for indulging his selfish request to wait two years and train separately. He expresses gratitude for their trust and patience, then gives the command to set sail for Fish-Man Island and the New World. The crew responds enthusiastically, ready to follow their captain on the next stage of their journey.
events.significance: Shows Luffy's growth as a captain, acknowledging his crew's sacrifices and trust. This moment reinforces the bond between Luffy and his crew and marks the official beginning of their New World adventure. It demonstrates that Luffy understands the weight of his decisions and appreciates his crew's unwavering loyalty.

quotes.text: Thanks for waiting, everyone! Now let's set sail!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy thanking his crew before departing for the New World

events.title: Franky Activates Ship Coating for Underwater Voyage
events.description: Franky dives beneath the Thousand Sunny to activate the coating system. He removes the air sack anchoring the ship and releases air into the special coating applied by Rayleigh. The coating inflates into a massive bubble that completely envelops the ship, preparing it for the underwater journey to Fish-Man Island.
events.significance: Demonstrates the crucial preparation that enables the Straw Hats to travel 10,000 meters underwater to reach Fish-Man Island. This technology, applied by Rayleigh during the two-year timeskip, is essential for accessing the New World via the underwater route.

events.title: The Straw Hats Submerge and Depart for Fish-Man Island
events.description: With the coating activated and all preparations complete, the Thousand Sunny begins to sink beneath the ocean's surface. The crew waves goodbye to Rayleigh, Hancock, Perona, and their other allies as the ship descends into the deep sea, beginning their journey to Fish-Man Island 10,000 meters below. The Marines can only watch helplessly as the Straw Hats disappear into the ocean depths.
events.significance: Marks the definitive end of the Return to Sabaody Arc and the beginning of the crew's journey into the second half of the Grand Line. This is one of the most important transitional moments in the series, as the crew officially enters the New World era. It represents the culmination of two years of preparation and training, and the start of new adventures that will eventually lead to Luffy becoming Pirate King.

quotes.text: To Fish-Man Island! To the New World!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy declaring their destination as the ship submerges

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy greeting his crew after two years of separation

quotes.text: Thanks for waiting, everyone! Now let's set sail!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy thanking his crew before departing for the New World

quotes.text: I will not let you lay a finger on Luffy!
quotes.speaker: Boa Hancock
quotes.context: Hancock declaring her protection of Luffy to the Marines

quotes.text: We will meet again someday. Until then, keep getting stronger!
quotes.speaker: Rayleigh

quotes.text: To Fish-Man Island! To the New World!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy declaring their destination as the ship submerges

themes.description: The episode centers on the emotional reunion of the Straw Hat crew after two years apart, emphasizing the unbreakable bonds between nakama (crewmates) and how their relationships have only grown stronger through separation and individual growth.
themes.symbolism: The complete crew gathering on the Thousand Sunny symbolizes unity, wholeness, and the family coming back together after trials that made each member stronger.
culturalReferences: The importance of loyalty and commitment in Japanese culture

themes.description: This episode represents a fresh start for the Straw Hats, marking their official entry into the New World as a stronger, more mature crew ready to face greater challenges.
themes.symbolism: The ship descending into the ocean depths symbolizes diving into the unknown, a rebirth as they leave behind their old selves and embrace their new strength and potential.

themes.description: Luffy's acknowledgment of his crew's sacrifice in waiting two years highlights the theme that true strength comes from recognizing and appreciating the efforts of others, not just individual power.
themes.symbolism: Each crew member's transformation represents their personal sacrifices and dedication to the collective dream of helping Luffy become Pirate King.

themes.description: The willingness of allies like Hancock, Rayleigh, and Perona to risk themselves to protect the Straw Hats demonstrates how Luffy's kindness and charisma inspire fierce loyalty even from those outside his crew.
themes.symbolism: Multiple forces converging to protect the Straw Hats symbolizes how genuine connections create networks of support that transcend official allegiances.

characterSpotlights.role: Captain reuniting his crew and leading them forward
characterSpotlights.development: Luffy shows maturity by explicitly thanking his crew for their patience and sacrifice, demonstrating growth as a captain who understands the weight of his decisions and values his nakama's dedication.
keyActions: Arrives at the Thousand Sunny with Zoro and Sanji
Reunites with the full crew for the first time in two years
Thanks his crew for waiting and following his plan
Commands the departure to Fish-Man Island
Bids farewell to Rayleigh and allies
quotes: Thanks for waiting, everyone! Now let's set sail!
To Fish-Man Island! To the New World!

characterSpotlights.role: Mentor bidding farewell to his student
characterSpotlights.development: Rayleigh's emotional goodbye shows his pride in Luffy's growth and his hope for the new generation. His tears reveal the depth of his attachment to Luffy and his investment in the boy's success.
keyActions: Protects the Straw Hats from Marines by slashing the ground
Bids emotional farewell to Luffy with tears
Reflects on the two years of training
Watches the crew depart for the New World
quotes: We will meet again someday. Until then, keep getting stronger!

characterSpotlights.role: Protector willing to defy the World Government
characterSpotlights.development: Hancock's intervention demonstrates that her love for Luffy has not diminished and that she's willing to risk her Warlord position to ensure his safety, showing her character's commitment to her feelings.
keyActions: Arrives with the Kuja Pirates to protect Luffy
Blocks Marine ships with her vessel
Openly defies Marine orders as a Warlord
Helps enable the Straw Hats' escape
quotes: I will not let you lay a finger on Luffy!

characterSpotlights.role: Shipwright preparing the vessel for underwater journey
characterSpotlights.development: Franky's technical expertise and new cyborg upgrades prove crucial for the journey, showcasing how his two years with Vegapunk's technology elevated his capabilities.
keyActions: Displays his new BF-37 cyborg body
Prepares the Thousand Sunny for underwater descent

mangaDifferences.difference: In the manga, Rayleigh's tears are shown during Luffy's declaration about becoming Pirate King. In the anime, this emotional moment is shown after Luffy starts running toward the ship, creating a slightly different timing for Rayleigh's emotional reaction.
The anime extends the reunion scenes with additional dialogue and reactions from crew members seeing each other for the first time in two years, adding more emotional depth to the gathering.

trivia.fact: This is the first episode where all nine Straw Hat Pirates appear together since Episode 404, marking a separation of 118 episodes spanning approximately two years of real-world broadcast time (2009-2011).
Episode 522 is the final episode of the Return to Sabaody Arc, which at only 6 episodes (517-522) is one of the shortest arcs in One Piece anime history.

sources.title: Return to Sabaody Arc - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The opening theme 'We Go!' by Hiroshi Kitadani is considered an 'answer song' to the first One Piece opening 'We Are!' which Kitadani also performed. Both songs bookend different eras of the Straw Hats' journey.
Episode 522 adapts manga Chapter 602, titled 'Downward Ho!' The episode covers pages 2-17 of the chapter.
The episode achieved a TV rating of 10.9% in Japan, ranking 3rd in its timeslot, demonstrating the strong viewer interest in the crew's reunion.
Rear Admiral Catacombo makes his debut in this episode as an anime-original character expansion - while he appears in the manga, his role is more prominently featured in the anime.
